node.title: Florida lawmakers strip Disney of special tax status
node.description: The move comes in the wake of a political clash between the company and the governor.

node.title: Search for missing fisherman suspended
node.description: The search for a man who failed to return from a fishing trip in the Bay of Plenty on Easter has been suspended for the weekend.

node.title: Nasa to send another balloon from the South to the stratosphere
node.description: The American space agency is getting ready to launch its fourth mission from Wanaka.

node.title: Police accused of insensitivity over Kaoss Price's death
node.description: A lawyer representing the whƒÅnau of a Taranaki man shot and killed by police says their statements about the incident are insensitive.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 9390 new cases, 13 deaths - including one aged under 20
node.description: There have been 9390 new cases of Covid-19 reported in the community today and 13 further deaths, including one person aged under 20.

node.title: Government begins drafting indigenous rights plan
node.description: Indigenous rights, co-governance and He Puapua: the government has started work on a plan and intends to consult widely on it soon.

node.title: Wheels up as Palmerston North welcomes back petrolheads
node.description: Engines are revving and bar tills ringing in Palmerston North for the city's biggest weekend of the year.

node.title: Canterbury flash flood damages houses
node.description: A flash flood in a small settlement south of Christchurch has damaged more than three houses overnight.

node.title: Few children experienced adverse side effects after Pfizer vaccine - survey
node.description: Most children aged 5 to 11 did not experience a reaction after receiving the Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine, according to new figures from the Ministry of Health

node.title: Australian opposition leader tests positive for Covid-19 amid election campaign
node.description: Australian Labor leader Anthony Albanese will be forced to isolate at home for the next week after testing positive for Covid-19, just four weeks before the national election.

node.title: Fatbergs lead to sewage overflow into wetland, beach in Tasman District
node.description: A raw sewage overflow in Stephens Bay was caused by the fat residue buildup in the wastewater network near Kaiteriteri.

node.title: Japan agrees $31 billion extra budget to tackle rising living costs
node.description: Japan's ruling coalition has agreed a supplementary budget to support lower-income households and small firms, signalling more spending for the heavily indebted nation.

node.title: Aussie Super Rugby teams a gift or a curse for All Blacks?
node.description: Will Australian Super Rugby teams provide some genuine competition for New Zealand sides this year?

node.title: McCarthy told GOP leaders he wanted Trump to resign after Jan. 6, recording shows
node.description: The House minority leader allegedly told GOP leaders, "I've had it with this guy," according to a New York Times report.

node.title: Owners look to future of abandoned Waiwera resort
node.description: Wairewa's long abandoned thermal resort is being marketed as having extraordinary potential for tourism as the current owners look for a development partner or buyer. Audio

node.title: Consumer credit demand stays on the downward spiral
node.description: Omicron outbreak, rising interest rates and tough lending rules are affecting people's ability and appetite to borrow as consumer credit demand continues to plunge.

node.title: Door opens for some South Islanders to resume recycling soft plastics
node.description: For those in many parts of the South Island, it's been a long time since they could recycle soft plastic waste.

node.title: Philadelphia to end mask mandate days after reinstating it
node.description: The mask mandate went into effect in Philadelphia on Monday.

node.title: Police killing of Kaoss Price 'drastic', friend says
node.description: A family friend of Kaoss Price, the young man shot dead by police on Saturday night in Taranaki, says there was no justification for shooting him because he was unarmed.

node.title: Super Rugby's big weekend in Melbourne may be a fizzer or a flop
node.description: With Super Rugby lurching from disaster to triumph this season, the latest innovation could go either way, Jamie Wall writes.

node.title: 'Blood and fear everywhere' after deadly IS blast
node.description: Dozens of people have been killed or injured in four explosions across Afghanistan on Thursday, local officials and journalists have said.

node.title: Teen facing firearms, disorderly behaviour charges over attack on milk tanker
node.description: Police have arrested two more people linked to an attack on a milk tanker in Waikato last month.

node.title: Obama blames social media for "turbocharging some of humanity's worst impulses"
node.description: The former president said the current information ecosystem is deepening existing racial and religious divides.

node.title: 'The vision was to give voice to our ancestors': MƒÅori battle story brought to life

node.title: Contact Energy to work with UK-based solar power developer on generation projects
node.description: Contact Energy is teaming up with an international solar developer for a series of grid-scale solar generation projects.

node.title: Soaring inflation puts pressure on transport and construction industries
node.description: The trucking industry says its operators will have to pass on any increases in fuel costs to customers, while construction costs have increased by 18 percent in the last year. Audio

node.title: Disability advocate outraged by Ministry of Health legal fees
node.description: The Ministry of Health is spending hundreds of thousands of dollars on legal fees, fighting families that care for their disabled children.

node.title: Independent commissioners' term to run Tauranga council extended
node.description: The Local Government Minister is extending their roles at Tauranga City Council until an election in two years.
